metadata.name: EU AI Act obligation map
metadata.source: Regulation (EU) 2024/1689 on artificial intelligence (EU AI Act)
metadata.notes: Curated obligations for Snowdrop skill routing. This file is not legal advice.

risk_classes.high_risk_annex_i: AI systems that are safety components of products covered by existing EU sectoral law listed in Annex I (e.g., medical devices, aviation)
risk_classes.high_risk_annex_iii: Standalone AI systems listed in Annex III (e.g., biometrics, credit scoring, employment)
risk_classes.limited_risk: AI systems subject to transparency duties under Article 52 (e.g., chatbots, deepfakes)
risk_classes.general_purpose: General-purpose AI (GPAI) models made available as such (Title VIII Chapter V)
risk_classes.general_purpose_integrated: GPAI models integrated into high-risk systems by downstream providers or deployers
risk_classes.minimal_risk: Minimal or no-risk systems with no binding obligations

obligations.title: Risk management system
obligations.summary: Establish, document, implement, and maintain a continuous risk management system covering design, testing, mitigations, and monitoring for each high-risk AI system.
actions: Document risk identification, analysis, and mitigation loops for the full lifecycle
Link controls to validation/verification evidence before CE marking
Update the risk file whenever model updates or drifts are detected
obligations.deadline: Before placing the system on the market and continuously thereafter

obligations.title: Data governance and quality
obligations.summary: Ensure training, validation, and testing datasets are relevant, representative, free of errors, and documented with known biases and gaps.
actions: Define data lineage, cleaning, and augmentation procedures
Record limitations, statistical properties, and demographic coverage
Implement technical measures to detect and correct data errors

obligations.title: Technical documentation and instructions
obligations.summary: Compile Annex IV technical documentation and user instructions covering purpose, design choices, performance limits, and human oversight parameters.
actions: Produce Annex IV sections (system overview, algorithms, datasets, metrics)
Issue instructions for deployers covering configuration, input constraints, and oversight
Version-control documentation and relay updates downstream
evidence: Localization proof if deployed in EU languages
obligations.deadline: Before CE marking and whenever substantive changes occur

obligations.title: Quality management and conformity assessment
obligations.summary: Operate a documented quality management system, decide conformity assessment route, interact with notified bodies, and affix CE marking before placement on the market.
actions: Define responsibilities, policies, and validation plans within the QMS
Perform internal control or engage notified body per Annex VII
Register system in the EU database and affix CE marking
obligations.deadline: Before placing on the EU market

obligations.title: Post-market monitoring and incident reporting
obligations.summary: Operate a documented post-market monitoring system, collect input from deployers, and report serious incidents or malfunctioning within statutory deadlines.
actions: Implement telemetry or feedback channels with deployers
Evaluate corrective actions and update the risk file
Report serious incidents to national authorities within 15 days
obligations.deadline: Continuous; serious incidents within 15 days of awareness

obligations.title: Registration in the EU database
obligations.summary: Prior to market placement, high-risk AI systems must be registered in the EU database maintained by the Commission.
actions: Prepare registration data set
Submit via EU portal
Maintain accuracy of entries

obligations.title: Deployers must ensure competent human oversight
obligations.summary: Deployers appoint trained personnel, implement override mechanisms, and follow providers' instructions to ensure meaningful human oversight.
actions: Assign accountable human supervisors with authority to intervene
Provide training on system capabilities, limits, and safe use
Document override and fallback procedures

obligations.title: Deployers responsible for input data and monitoring
obligations.summary: Verify input data is relevant, ensure logs are stored, and cooperate with providers and authorities during monitoring or incidents.
actions: Validate data before ingestion
Preserve logs for the mandated retention period
Share logs with providers/authorities upon request

obligations.title: Deployers must report serious incidents
obligations.summary: Notify providers and competent authorities within 15 days when a serious incident or malfunction arises during use.
actions: Trigger internal escalation when risk to health, safety, or fundamental rights occurs
Notify provider to support post-market monitoring
Submit formal report to national authority

obligations.title: Importer and distributor diligence
obligations.summary: Verify that providers performed conformity steps, refuse non-compliant systems, and take corrective action when risks emerge.
actions: Check CE marking, EU declaration, and registration
Ensure instructions accompany the system
Suspend distribution and inform authorities if non-compliance or serious risk is found
obligations.deadline: Before placing on the market and ongoing

obligations.title: General-purpose AI provider transparency package
obligations.summary: Create technical documentation, policies for misuse, and provide downstream deployers with the information needed to integrate GPAI models compliantly.
actions: Publish capabilities, limitations, and high-level training data description
Establish acceptable-use policies and safety features
Offer interface or documentation so integrators can run conformity checks
obligations.deadline: Before making the GPAI model available

obligations.title: GPAI provider misuse and incident handling
obligations.summary: Monitor misuse, share evaluation results with the AI Office, and report systemic incidents linked to GPAI capabilities.
actions: Conduct and document systemic capability evaluations
Notify the AI Office and national authorities of serious incidents
Provide corrective updates or safety filters to integrators

obligations.title: GPAI integrators supporting high-risk use
obligations.summary: Downstream providers integrating GPAI into high-risk systems must conduct their own conformity checks and document adaptations and additional data.
actions: Document fine-tuning datasets and changes to model behavior
Re-run relevant parts of the Annex IV technical file
Coordinate with the original GPAI provider for safety updates
obligations.deadline: Before placing the adapted system on the market

obligations.title: Transparency for limited-risk AI
obligations.summary: Inform individuals they interact with AI systems (chatbots) or that content is artificially generated or manipulated (deepfakes); obtain consent where required.
actions: Display clear notices for conversational agents
Label synthetic audio/video
Maintain opt-out or human escalation channels
